citations.narrative:
The Licensee was unable to provide documentation for examinations performed by the Attending Veterinarian for a
female Havapoo (#901001000065728). The Licensee stated that the animal was observed to be small in size and they
notified their attending veterinarian who examined the animal twice but could not provide records regarding these
examinations. Failure to document results of examinations performed may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to
determine if the animals are receiving adequate veterinary care. Medical records must be maintained and include the
dates and findings/results of all screening, routine, or other required or recommended test or examination. Correct by
documenting the results of all examinations and ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required
information. Correct by 11-DEC-2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(b)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The Licensee was unable to provide documentation for examinations performed by the Attending Veterinarian for a 
female Havapoo (#901001000065728). The Licensee stated that the animal was observed to be small in size and they 
notified their attending veterinarian who examined the animal twice but could not provide records regarding these 
examinations. Failure to document results of examinations performed may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to 
determine if the animals are receiving adequate veterinary care. Medical records must be maintained and include the 
dates and findings/results of all screening, routine, or other required or recommended test or examination. Correct by 
documenting the results of all examinations and ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required 
information. Correct by 11-DEC-2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
